Package com.regex.sre.graph

Class DirectedGraphDFSUtils

java.lang.Object
com.regex.sre.graph.DirectedGraphDFSUtils
public class DirectedGraphDFSUtils extends Object
The DirectedGraphDFSUtils class is written to traverse the DirectedGraph using DFS and mark the visited vertices true, which is in turn used in simple regular expression parsing done using non-deterministic finite automata approach. This class contains only one field consisting of the vertices that have been already visited

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DirectedGraphDFSUtils(DirectedGraph directedGraph, int source)
    Given a DirectedGraph and a source vertex, this method computes all the vertices that can be reached starting from source and marks them in the marked array
    DirectedGraphDFSUtils(DirectedGraph directedGraph, org.apache.commons.collections4.bag.HashBag<Integer> adjacentVertices)
    Given a DirectedGraph and a HashBag containing the adjacent vertices to a source vertex, this method marks all the vertices that can be reached from the vertices in the bag as true in the 'visited'

  • Method Details

    • checkIfVisited

      public boolean checkIfVisited(int v)
      Is there a directed path from the source vertex (or any of the source vertices) and vertex v?
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex
      Returns:
      true if there is a directed path, false otherwise
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - unless 0 <= v < verticesCount
